channel.title: First Grunge
channel.description:
Well... I made my first ever real grunge signature today. I normally just work with abstract works. Please give suggestions, etc...
[img]http://x-cel-psc.com/forums/alexiasignature.gif[/img]
-Alexia

item.title: First Grunge
item.dc:creator: @WhiteShadow WhiteShadow
item.description:
@WhiteShadow wrote:

[quote=“alexia, post:3, topic:37068”]About 700. I need suggestions on grunge signatures… not signatures as a whole.

-Alexia[/quote]

uh… 700? WOW

Anyways.

  • Use a render!(: That way you can use Motion blur and shit on the render and the background color will actually be your renders swirl of colors. Before that though brush in a black background with a grunge brush(use white). Then you overlay them.
  • Blend the text a bit||effects? It’s dull.
  • Either just use one color, or blend it! (Motion Blur, Overlay, Gaussion Blur, try different effects)

Read full topic

item.title: First Grunge
item.dc:creator: @pookey71 Pookey71
item.description:
@pookey71 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:7, topic:37068”][quote author=alexia link=topic=52635.msg650397#msg650397 date=1166578653]
I don’t really fucking care. I want suggestions so that I can make it better.

-Alexia
[/quote]

The colors go awful together, your name text is horrible, and it looks like a copy-paste job.

Happy?[/quote]
GO Un-Named You owned

Read full topic

item.title: First Grunge
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

after you brush add a render duplicate the layer go to guagasion blur set it to 10.0 radius and keep duplicating the blurred layer and move each layer next to each other or whatever untill it fills up the whole canvas then it will blend more and should Look 5 times better.

Read full topic
